890123_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Medical thoracoscopy with mediastinal lymph node biopsy.
INDICATION: Undiagnosed mediastinal lymphadenopathy.
TECHNIQUE: Under local anesthesia and moderate sedation, a single port was established. The mediastinal pleura was opened to access the subcarinal (Station 7) and aortopulmonary window stations. Adequate tissue sampling was achieved using rigid forceps. Hemostasis was secured, and a chest tube was placed.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Patient: [REDACTED]
MRN: [REDACTED]
DOB: [REDACTED] (67 years old)
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]

Attending: Dr. Andrew Scott, MD - Interventional Pulmonology
Fellow: Dr. Michelle Adams, MD - IP Fellow

Indication: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy with non-diagnostic EBUS, concern for sarcoidosis vs lymphoma

Procedure: Medical thoracoscopy with diagnostic biopsy of mediastinal lymph nodes

Anesthesia: Moderate sedation with local anesthesia

Technique:
Patient [REDACTED] lateral decubitus position. After local anesthesia with 1% lidocaine, a single 1cm incision made in 5th intercostal space, mid-axillary line. Trocar inserted and semi-rigid pleuroscope (LTF-160) introduced.

Findings:
- Normal visceral and parietal pleura
- Enlarged station 7 lymph node visible through mediastinal pleura
- Multiple enlarged lymph nodes in aortopulmonary window

Procedure:
Using blunt dissection, mediastinal pleura opened over the subcarinal region. Multiple biopsies (x6) obtained from enlarged station 7 node using rigid biopsy forceps. Additional biopsies (x4) from AP window nodes. All specimens sent for permanent pathology, flow cytometry, and AFB/fungal cultures.

No bleeding complications. 20Fr chest tube placed. Patient tolerated procedure well.

A. Scott, MD / M. Adams, MD
